block.p: The five most e-mailed articles from nytimes.com/sports for April 21 to 27.
1. FOR N.F.L. DRAFT, THE BIGGEST (XXXXXXL) SLEEPER -- With speed and athleticism, a defensive lineman sheds his anonymity. (Published April 25)
2. FINDING THE SWEET SPOT IN A HALL OF FAME SWING -- Alex Rodriguez is off to one of the hottest starts in baseball history. (April 23)
3. BASEBALL LOOKS TO CREATE A POSSIBLE PORTAL TO CUBA -- Baseball is preparing to re-establish a relationship with Cuba if the United States lifts its trade embargo. (April 26)
4. FIVE HOME RUNS, ONE BIG SWEEP FOR RED SOX -- Boston beats the Yankees with the help of four straight homers. (April 23)
5. JOHNSON HAS NO BAGGAGE AND A SEAT IN FIRST CLASS -- Calvin Johnson, perhaps the best player in the N.F.L. draft, lets his receiving do his talking. (April 26)
